input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ŁUKASIEWICZ RESEARCH NETWORK - INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING. Summary: Tests of Composite Insulators 110Kv, 220Kv, 400Kv.. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase of research services: 1) Alternating voltage test at mains frequency in rain for insulators with a rated voltage of 110 kV and 220 kV and switching voltage test in rain for insulators with a rated voltage of 400 kV. As part of the test, the withstand voltage should be checked will determine the jump voltage. The test should be carried out in accordance with the requirements of PN-EN 61109, p. 11.1, according to the methodology given in PN-EN 60060-1, p. 6.3.2. Number of test objects: 400kV composite insulators 4 pieces, 220kV composite insulators 14 pieces, 110kV composite insulators 11 pieces. 2) Check boundary surfaces and connections - a test in the field of structural tests of composite linear insulators. The insulator should be checked by subjecting it to a steep-front impulse voltage test. This test should be carried out in accordance with the requirements specified in the PN-EN 62217 standard, section 9.2.7.3., but without carrying out tests preliminary to this trial. In this test, an impulse voltage of 2000 kV/s should be used. Number of test objects: Composite insulators 400kV 2 pieces, Composite insulators 220kV 7 pieces, Composite insulators 110kV 6 pcs.... Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: INSTITUTE OF LABOR AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS. Summary: Conducting 60 Idi Interviews as Part of the Research Project Entitled: "Skilled Workers from Ukraine on the Polish Labor Market. Employment Potential and Opportunities. Description: Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order consisting in conducting a qualitative study of in-depth IDI interviews with Ukrainian citizens working in Poland (n = 60) as part of a research project implemented by the Institute of Labor and Social Affairs entitled: Qualified Ukrainian workers on the Polish market work. Potential and employment opportunities financed from the state budget under the Science for Society II program, financed by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education. The aim of the study is to diagnose the professional situation of qualified and highly qualified citizens of Ukraine who stay in Poland. The research will cover people who have been living for at least 12 months in five large cities in Poland where the share of Ukrainian citizens is the highest: Warsaw, Łodź, Wroclaw, Krakow and Gdańsk, including people who arrived after the outbreak of the conflict with Russia in February 2022 year, as well as those who settled in our country earlier. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management. Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru .... output.Purchaser_Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
output.Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management
output.Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru ...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KRAKOW UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY TADEUSZ KOŚCIUSZKO. Summary: Carrying out Measurements with a Fwd (Hwd) Machine in 2025 - 2027. Description: The subject of this order is to perform measurements of FWD (HWD) machines. The measurement is intended to determine the load-bearing capacity of the railway track structure by recording the track deflection under dynamic load. Measurement and analysis should be performed in accordance with the principles contained in applicable standards and guidelines for tests with the FWD device. Spatial scope of the measurement covered by the order. The test will be carried out in two locations, a total of approximately 700 measurements, in accordance with this list: Test track in Migrodzie - approximately 400 measurements Euroterminal - approximately 300 measurements Other indicated place or places (crossings) railways).Method of measurement.The measurement should be performed using a FWD (Falling Weight Deflectometer) or HWD (Heavy Weight Deflectometer) device that records the deflection of the railway surface under dynamic load. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 1 to this SWZ Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order and Annex No. 4 to the SWZ Draft contract.. Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management. Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru .... Published Date: 2025-10-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Tender Value: 3000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-16. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)
output.Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services

The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...

This contract supports Phase 2 of the Frontex Counter-Unmanned Aircraft System (C-UAS) Solutions Prize Contest, an initiative to develop innovative technologies countering unauthorized UAV activities—such as illicit surveillance and smuggling at the European Union-s external borders.
